title: Understanding the Kübler-Ross Model
text: The Kübler-Ross model is a framework that describes the emotional stages people go through when dealing with grief and loss. It is often referred to as the five stages of grief.

title: Identifying the Correct Stages
text: The five stages of grief in the Kübler-Ross model are not related to external factors like socioeconomic status or mental health services. They are internal emotional responses.

hintAnswer: denial, anger, bargaining, depression, and acceptance
title: Listing the Stages
text: Try to recall the five stages of grief as described by Kübler-Ross. They start with denial and end with acceptance.
choices: factors such as socioeconomic status, social support, and access to mental health services
